results.title: The Art of eating
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film, a visual and gustatory delight, mixes humour with superb food and takes us into the banquet hall where le Club Prosper Montagne, regarded as North America’s most knowledgeable gastronomic society, is holding its biannual dinner. It also takes us into the kitchen where Chef Marcel Kretz is coordinating this delicate event.

results.title: Art of age
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Stanley Hawes and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Four elderly people reflect on the possibilities of maintaining a fulfilling and productive life into old age. They all tell of there involvement with community groups and of the way they teach others their talents.

results.title: Army aviation
results.brief_description: The training of light aircraft pilots, members of the 16 Army Light Aircraft Squadron, at R.A.N. and R.A.A.F. stations. Instruction covers all stages from theory to flight in both fixed and rotary winged aircraft, including army applications for spotting, photography, supply dropping, evaluation of wounded and maintenance of aircraft. No other credits available.

results.title: Army apprentices school
results.brief_description: The Army Apprentices School at Balcombe, Victoria, offers training in numerous trades for a period of three years. For a further year boys are attached to an Army unit, and then the apprenticeship is completed and their qualifications as tradesmen will be recognized by civilian standards. This film illustrates the facilities offered for training in toolmaking, welding, carpentry, plumbing, blacksmithing, and machining. It points out that all apprentices are given theoretical training in English, Mathematics and trade science.

results.title: Arid zones of Peru
results.brief_description: The work of Arid Zones Research Institute in Peru. Research on the soil, underground water, climate and farming practice in the Ica valley. How areas of desert have been brought into production, chiefly for high quality cotton. Incidental impressions of the life of the people, with a background of Peruvian folk music. No other credits available. Produced for UNESCO.

results.title: Are drugs the answer?
results.brief_description: Dr. Cole, psychologist, and ex-student of Dr. Timothy Leary, leads a classroom discussion on the reasons for drug taking, informs on the three main categories of drugs, the need for education of young people and for criminal prosecution of drug dealers. The film was made with the co-operation of three U.S. high schools and their students. No other credits available.

results.title: Arches of faith
results.creator_credit: Kurt Baum and African Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Voortrekker Memorial, the story behind it and its dedication in 1949. Bas-reliefs on the memorial and re-enacted sequences show the Voortrekkers setting out across the Brakensberg to the Free State, Natal and Transvaal, the massacre of Piet Retief’s party by Dingaan and his Zulu warriors, the subsequent Voortrekker victory at Bloody River, and the establishment of new farmlands. The celebrations at the dedication of the Memorial and the sentiments behind it.

results.title: The Apprentice
results.creator_credit: Alan Harkness, Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: Answers the questions of potential apprentices and their parents about how the apprenticeship scheme works in Australian industry by concentrating on Robert, an apprentice fitter and turner with an automotive firm. Robert, his father and his supervisor give their views on the training involved, which is intended to develop a boy’s character as well as to produce a good craftsman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Harkness, Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Fontana Films
